text: French green lentils are something I
always keep stocked to my pantry because
they are so easy to cook and so nutrient
packed I'm gonna make a French warm
lentil salad that is so delicious so
satisfying great lunch or dinner to get
started let's cook the lentils so start
with 1 and 1/3 cup green lentils and to
that add water to cover the lentils by
about 2 inches over the lentil line for
me that was about 4 cups of water so
turn this to high give it a good season
about a teaspoon and a half of kosher
salt and let this come up to a boil so
while this is coming up to a boil I'm
gonna work on the vinaigrette for the
salad
super simple really really bright
delicious vinaigrette start with 3
tablespoons of fresh lemon juice so
that's usually about mmm a lemon and a
half here 2 3 ok so to that add 1
tablespoon of country style Dijon
mustard all right
so we'll give this a little whisk here
and slowly add 1/3 cup extra virgin
olive oil
okay seasoned with a little salt and
pepper okay so just set this aside so
you'll find these lentils called French
green lentils sometimes they're labeled
Lippe the reason I love using these
lentils is that they hold their shape a
little bit better than other varieties
and they're they're just so delicious
they have a really nice minerality to
them they're available at most grocery
stores now so definitely keep your eye
out for them
all right lentils are up to a boil so
let's just reduce the temperature down
to pretty low simmer we're gonna cook
these until they are nice and tender but
not mushy anywhere between 18 and 22
minutes start checking around 18 minutes
all right
so lentils are cooked drained hanging
out comfortably in a large bowl let's
get started with the aromatics so I have
my heat up to medium add about three
tablespoons of olive oil you could also
use butter here I have one onion chopped
two stalks of celery also diced you want
to have a pretty similar size dice on
all these vegetables you will notice
them because the lentils aren't that big
so you want to make sure they're similar
size and two that adds three carrots
diced so we want to cook this over a
moderate heat you don't want to develop
any color on the vegetables just keep
them nice and sweet and tender add a bit
of salt all right I'm gonna work on the
Swiss chard here so I have one bunch of
Swiss chard love Swiss chard really
really great flavor great texture I also
find that it has a nice earthy mineral
flavor so it matches the lentils well so
what I want to do here is remove these
hearty stems they need a little bit
extra time to cook then the green
portion so we're gonna treat the stems
as if they're a vegetable in the
mirepoix as well and just add those let
them saute so I'm shooting for a quarter
inch dice here just slice down the
middle lengthwise maybe I'll do that for
these two -
so some of these larger guys just slice
down the middle and then just thinly
slice crosswise this is such a beautiful
color
Swiss chard comes in lots and lots of
different colors you can get the bunch
of rainbow which has red green white
golden yellow just give this a nice
little chop and we'll add these they
look like little jewels right so this
should take about six to eight minutes
for the vegetables to become tender
alright so for the leaves here we're
gonna thinly slice into ribbons and when
you're doing big leafy greens like this
it sort of helps to curl them up into a
little spiral this just helps wrangle
them a little bit easier for slicing
make sure slicing more even you're not
all over the board you're in a nice
little compact row so dark leafy greens
great source of iron great source of
calcium and I always like to try to pair
dark leafy greens with a citrus
especially something like lemon juice
because that helps your body absorb more
of the nutrients and minerals so you're
getting the most bang for your buck
which is why we have a lemon vinaigrette
on deck ready to go so do this at our
Swiss chard ribbons and we're cooking
this until they wilt and become just
tender which is three to four minutes
okay it's been about three minutes you
can see the Swiss chard is nice and
tender but still bright green you want
to keep a nice bright green fresh flavor
okay
so into the bowl of lentils it goes all
right well we're stirring let's add the
vinaigrette remember our little lemon
Dijon vinaigrette and it goes such a
cheerful color so this is one of those
salads that I think benefits from a
quick little stand let it stand for
about ten minutes or so just to let the
flavors meld a little bit more this is
something that will also taste even
better tomorrow so look forward to
leftovers all right so we're gonna let
this hang out for about 10 minutes or so
so this guy's hung out for about 10
minutes so let's add the final
components here so I've got 1/3 cup of
chopped toasted almonds this adds a
really nice nuttiness nice crunch so
give this a stir and then for finishing
finishing touches 4 ounces of goat
cheese and I just sort of crumbled these
up now I do want to save a couple of
bits for garnish because I just think
that's so pretty but we'll add the rest
here the goat cheese adds such a nice
creamy tangy mnestheus I wanted to keep
this vegan you could totally omit it it
would be delicious without just give
this a little stir nice and creamy it
looks great all right let's just give it
a little taste
mmm pepper lentils love pepper last but
not least one cup of parsley leaves I've
left them whole here they're not chopped
the whole leaves are gonna give a really
nice textural contrast a little
something to bite into looking good
so let's plate up so this salad is good
to go
just like this if you want to make it a
little bit more Hardy or you can add a
poached egg which is what I'm in the
mood for today so delicious mmm
all right so I poached a couple eggs
over here definitely don't forget to
turn the heat off if you pre poach so
that they don't get overcooked that's
nice and tender so just add that here
seasoned with a little salt and pepper
you can sprinkle on a little bit more
goat cheese for garnish and I always
like to top everything with a little
drizzle of olive oil just makes it extra
nice all right
doesn't this look wonderful if you need
